alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Meigs, southwestern Wirt, northwestern Roane, northern Jackson and south central Wood Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ravenswood, or near Ripley, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ripley, Ravenswood, Sandyville, Reedy, Cottageville, Mount Alto, Peewee, Evans, Morristown, Rockport, and Leroy. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 137 and 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Ohio...and western, central and northwestern West Virginia.
